com.communote.server.api.core.note.processor

Interface NoteStoringPostProcessorManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoteStoringPostProcessorManagerImpl

    public interface NoteStoringPostProcessorManager
    Extension point for adding components which can process a note after it was stored.

    This extension point respects the order value of the registered extensions when calling them. Those with a higher order value will be called first.

    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addProcessor(NoteStoringPostProcessor processor)
      Add a processor.
      void process(Collection<Note> notes, NoteStoringTO orginalNoteStoringTO, Map<String,String> properties)
      Process the provided notes synchronously by the registered processors.
      void processAsynchronously(Long noteId, NoteStoringPostProcessorContext context)
      Process a note asynchronously by invoking all registered processors.
      void removeProcessor(Class<? extends NoteStoringPostProcessor> processorType)
      Remove a processor if it is present.

    • Method Detail

      • addProcessor

        void addProcessor(NoteStoringPostProcessor processor)
        Add a processor. If there is already a processor of the same type, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        processor - the processor to register

      • process

        void process(Collection<Note> notes,
             NoteStoringTO orginalNoteStoringTO,
             Map<String,String> properties)
      throws TaskAlreadyExistsException
        Process the provided notes synchronously by the registered processors. This will also schedule any asynchronous processing if necessary.
        Parameters:
        notes - the notes to add
        orginalNoteStoringTO - the original note storing TO from which the notes were created
        properties - some properties to be stored for all notes
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyExistsException - if there is already a task for processing that note

      • processAsynchronously

        void processAsynchronously(Long noteId,
                           NoteStoringPostProcessorContext context)
        Process a note asynchronously by invoking all registered processors.
        Parameters:
        noteId - the id of the note
        context - the context with details to be passed to the extensions

      • removeProcessor

        void removeProcessor(Class<? extends NoteStoringPostProcessor> processorType)
        Remove a processor if it is present.
        Parameters:
        processorType - the processor to unregister
